result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond T Swerdon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution is to be paid within the first year of probation.
Costs are to be paid within the first year of probation.
AODA and comply.  Random UA's per agent.  Submit DNA sample.  Not to possess any controlled substances without a valid Rx.

with Huber.

**AMENDED** 5-2-16  Defendant shall serve 60 days of conditional jail time as an alternative to revocation for violations.  Time is to begin on the date of the amended JOC signed by Judge.

records.addlTxt: Defendant deceased as of 8-31-17; unpaid restitution of $34.31 and court obligations of $521.43

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Order for defendant to serve 60days of conditional jail time as an alternative to revocation for violating his no contact and lying to agent.
from probation agent with Alternative to Revocation Agreement and proposed Amendment to JOC - fax
Copy of JOC mailed to defendant at 141 1/2 E. Emmett Street Portage, WI.  Returned unable to forward.
Restitution stipulation in the probation amount of $34.31 and a total of $37.74.

Defendant Raymond T Swerdon in court with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled no contest to Ct. 1.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Cts. 2 & 3 dismissed but read in.  On Ct. 1 court withheld sentencing placed defendant on probation for 2 years.  Conditions of probation include: AODA and comply, random U.A.'s per agent, submit DNA sample, $518.00 costs, $34.31 restitution plus surcharge, not to possess any controlled substances without a valid Rx.  30 days jail, with Huber.  Jail start on 2/13/16 at 7:00pm.  Costs and restitution to be paid in the first year of probation.
Copy of Letter from ADA Genda to Atty Ron Benavides re:  Discovery.
For Leave to File Additional Motions filed by ADA Christine M. Genda
and Notice of DNA and Witness List filed by ADA Christine M. Genda
For Leave to File Additional Motions filed by Atty Benavides
No contact with R.H.  Not to possess any controlled substances without a valid Rx.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Standard felony conditions.

Defendant Raymond T Swerdon by video, in custody with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  $1000.00 signature bond.  No contact with R.H.  Not to possess any controlled substances without a vaild Rx.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Standard felony conditions.   Defendant waived time limits for preliminary hearing.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 01:50 pm.  Return date scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
